name: Clarify Vague Task
description: Remote administrative assistant receives a short, unclear request to 'clean up the notes' and needs to ask for clarification without sounding rude or incompetent.
student_task: Your manager Karen Lopez sent you a short message asking you to 'clean up the notes from yesterday's meeting' but did not explain what format they want, who will read them, or when they are needed. Write an email to Karen. Politely restate what you think the task is, ask 1â€“3 clear questions about format and deadline, and confirm that you want to do the work correctly. Use simple, professional English.
counterpart_style: You are a busy but fair office manager. You appreciate clear questions and you prefer that people ask instead of guessing. You are direct but polite in your replies.
counterpart_context: You sent your assistant a short message asking them to clean up the notes from yesterday's meeting.
grading_focus: Focus on whether the student is polite, restates their understanding of the task, asks specific questions, and clearly shows they want to do the work correctly and on time.
starter_email_body:
Hey {student_name},

Can you clean up the notes from yesterday's meeting? I need them looking good before I share them with the team.

Thanks,
Karen
starter_email_generation_hint: Write a brief email from the office manager asking the assistant to 'clean up the notes from yesterday's meeting' without giving many details about format or deadline.
